titleStmt.title: healing of a sick man (Cosmas and Damianus?)

availability.p: © Digital Corpus of Literary Papyri. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License .

encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

revisionDesc.change: Finalized - Revised text and updated metadata.

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Correct underdots throughout, complete modern diacriticals; r1.6 indicate extension of vacat, r2.2 underdot instead of low-punctus, v1.2 θεραπεου -> θεραπευο, 4 add underdots, 5 add underdot, v2.4 add high-punctus and underdot, 5 add underdot, 6 separate gap from supplement.

Submit - Divided the text as per the orginal recto/verso organisation and added the division of the columns. I added as well punctutation. In my preview the high and low punctus are not visible they are shown as ((high-punctus)). I dont see the reason why, as I checked the code of my previous assignement in which there was *diple* and it is visible as a sign.
Finalized - Revised text and updated metadata.

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Correct underdots throughout, complete modern diacriticals; r1.6 indicate extension of vacat, r2.2 underdot instead of low-punctus, v1.2 θεραπεου -> θεραπευο, 4 add underdots, 5 add underdot, v2.4 add high-punctus and underdot, 5 add underdot, 6 separate gap from supplement.

Submit - Divided the text as per the orginal recto/verso organisation and added the division of the columns. I added as well punctutation. In my preview the high and low punctus are not visible they are shown as ((high-punctus)). I dont see the reason why, as I checked the code of my previous assignement in which there was *diple* and it is visible as a sign.
